Write a summary about 'astronomy'. Limit the output to 200 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It involves the observation and analysis of stars, galaxies, planets, and other celestial bodies, as well as the physical laws that govern their behavior. Astronomy uses a range of techniques, including telescopes, satellites, and mathematical models, to understand the universe's origin, evolution, and structure. Major subfields include cosmology, which focuses on the large-scale structure and evolution of the universe, and astrophysics, which applies principles of physics to understand celestial bodies and phenomena. Astronomy has contributed significantly to our understanding of the universe, including the discovery of exoplanets and the confirmation of the Big Bang theory. It continues to drive advancements in technology, physics, and our understanding of the cosmos.
